title: Canada court waives C$1.13 bln deposit in Quebec smoking case
text:

Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 02:02 BST - UK Markets open in 5 hrs 58 mins Canada court waives C$1.13 bln deposit in Quebec smoking case Reuters - UK Focus – 2 hours 8 minutes ago -0.03 
By Allison Lampert 
MONTREAL, July 23 (Reuters) - A Canadian appeal court ruled on Thursday that three major tobacco companies will not have to make a preliminary deposit of C$1.13 billion ($867.56 million) as they appeal a case that awarded more than C$15 billion in damages to Quebec smokers. 
Imperial Tobacco Canada, a subsidiary of British American Tobacco Plc, JTI-Macdonald Corp, part of Japan Tobacco (Other OTC: JAPAF - news ) Inc, and Rothmans, Benson & Hedges Inc - a subsidiary of Philip Morris International (Xetra: A0NDBJ - news ) - had originally been ordered by a lower court judge to deposit the amount in trust with their attorneys.
